guidePage.title: Usage Guide
guidePage.intro: This page walks you through the external links optimizer and shows how to call it from other systems.

items.env: Issue an access key in the admin portal or configure the default credentials in `.env.local`.
items.login: Sign in with your email or the admin account; after a successful login you will be redirected to the optimizer.
items.editor: In the “External Links” editor enter the English text, adjust preferred sites or blacklist, then click “Generate”.
items.settings: Use the Settings panel to switch language/theme and provide custom model or Serper API keys.
items.billing: Need credit? Click “Top Up” in the navigation bar to open the QR-code payment flow.

items.keywords: The AI extracts keywords and returns recommended links plus alternatives for each keyword.
items.history: Administrators can manage access keys and review usage inside the Admin portal.
items.feedback: A feedback button is always available in the header for questions or suggestions.

api.title: Remote API
api.description: External systems can call the GET endpoint `/api/external-links` with a valid access key to obtain link suggestions.

params.text: `text`: Required. The English content to analyse.
params.accessKey: `accessKey`: Required. The access key issued from the admin portal.
params.preferredSites: `preferredSites`: Optional. Comma-separated list of domains to prioritise.
params.model: `model`, `provider`, `baseUrl`, `apiKey`: Optional. Supply these to use a custom model.

nextSteps.readme: Check the project README for deployment details and environment variables.
nextSteps.support: Need help? Use the feedback dialog or contact an administrator.
